answers.answer: 32 weeks is considered the line- the point where the baby is enough developed to survive.  They would still need to spend 6 weeks plus at the hospital and may have health issues for life.

I've seen babies born as early as 25 weeks that have survived, the point of viability is 20 weeks (at that period the baby has a chance or surviving outside the mother) however the earlier they are the more issues that present. For example the lungs cannot function fully until about 34-35 weeks.

I work in a NICU and 30 week babies usually do well...though they most likely need a ventilator for a while and a drug called survanta to help develope their lungs. They won't be going home with you for a few weeks though.
My niece was born at 23 weeks. 1lb 20% chance of survival. She was in hospital for 3 months, actually got out earlier than expected. Her birthday is today! 9 Yeats old! :)
Mege26 that is a wonderful story! She is truly blessed

Yes its possible for baby to survive I hv a friend baby came out at 23 weeks she is alive spent 2months in icu but is healthy they had her on a feeding tube and medicine ...she is a miracle..and my baby was born 34 weeks he was 6 pounds 9 oz he was great gd luck
I think its different for everyone, maybe ask you Dr.   Are you in active labor or being induced for medical reasons?
My aunt had to have an emergency c section at 24 weeks because she had extreme preeclampsia with. her last pregnancy... my cousin was in the hospital 3 months but is tueni
Im a twin me n my brother were born at 7 months weight only 2lbs each due to a bus accident causing early labor for my mom I did have asthma bad frowning but me n my bro are 26 .
Yep I had my second at 30 weeks. He was 2lbs 11ozs he spent 5 weeks in the nicu. He will be 3 next month and he's perfect. Good luck :)
My husband was born at 26 weeks. He has asthma but nothing else.  He will be 30 next week.

My husband was born at 7 months he was 2 pounds his mom had to dress him in baby doll clothes he could fit in a shoe box when he was little he did have seizures and he did have to have something removed from his brain when he was little and he had to stay on seizures medicine up until he was about 26

question: Did any mother's have their little ones at 30 weeks?Was there any health issues?or did they come out healthy?
title: labor at 30 weeks
